intro: Corytoplectus cutucuensis, commonly known as the Cutucu sand goby, is a small marine fish found in the eastern Pacific Ocean. It belongs to the family Gobiidae and is characterized by its slender body and distinctive coloration. The plant aspect of this species refers to its habitat in sandy and muddy substrates of coastal and estuarine environments. It plays a role in the ecosystem by contributing to nutrient cycling and serving as prey for larger marine organisms. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern in certain regions.
